creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
Carsten Ziegeler wrote this:

- each jar (library) that is contained in the cvs must have
  an accompanying licences file (e.g. in cocoon those are all
  put in the legal directory)
- I think some of the jars do not have a licence that it 
  allows to put them in the apache cvs (I think at least
  this is true for mail and activation) - perhaps someone
  can give a pointer here?
- afaik the source code contained in the cvs must have apache
  package names, it's not allowed to have own source code
  with org.w3c.too packages
- all source files must have a proper apache licence. Currently
  there is a mixture.

creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
Steven Noels wrote:

"mail and activation.jar should be removed from CVS right away - ASF board's 
speaking."

They were removed by Gregor.
